0.ngo_name: ALOMBRO MAYU YAKU CHI AMEY AROGA AMYAA
0.Major_Activities1:
AMYAA
The Alombro Mayu Yaku Chi Amey Aroga (AMYAA), Society for social transformation was registered under the Societies Registration Act 1860 on June 28 2002 with its head office at Mayu-II, Roing of Lower Dibang Valley District. On 17th November 2009 the Head Office was shifted from Roing to Namphai-I, Miao of Changlang District. This shifting of Head Office was done on ground of feasibility in reaching out to the needy and the poor in remote rural villages. This society was established with the vision to combat poverty, illiteracy, ill health, corruption, injustice and suppression of the poor. The society focuses at working for the all round development of the tribal communities. It aims at supporting the backward tribal communities to become self-sustainable and self-reliant.
 
Vision
AMYAA envisages a society where everyone co-exists in mutual respect and understanding and strive for justice, peace and love.

Mission
AMYAA is to work for the all round development of the tribal poor with special attention towards the most vulnerable groups of the society, children, youth and women. It follows Right-based Approach in promoting developmental changes through creating awareness, capacity building, and training and to establish a self-sustainable and self-reliant society in Arunachal Pradesh. 

Location
AMYAA is located in the scenic beauty of Namphai-I, with swift flowing breath taking scene of Dehing River as its background. There is greenery and a sight to cherish nature surrounding the Office. 

Office Set Up
The office is well furnished with computer and other electronic equipments for documentation and processing of project related activities. 

MAJOR ACTIVITIES

1) Training cum Production Centre (Handloom and Handicrafts) 
Aim: 
To promote traditional attires
To promote traditional art
To train local artisans
To train and help the village youth (illiterate & educated unemployed youth) to develop their skills and to become self-employable and employable
To provide employment in the centre
To improve the economic standards of their families
To raise the economy of the society
To reduce the number of youth getting addicted to anti-social activities
Activities Undertaken: Handloom
Traditional Handloom - Mekhela set, traditional shawl, traditional coat, traditional turban.
Activities Undertaken: Handicrafts
Making of various items such as kitchen utensils, dry flowers, statues of state animal & bird, traditional statues, decorative articles etc

2) Youth (educated unemployed youth)
Skill Development Programme (SDP) & Rural Entrepreneurship Development Programme (REDP) for educated unemployed youth
Career guidance & counseling 
Capacity Building & Training on various trade skills
Exposure  

3) Livelihood
SHG formation
Farmer Club formation
Promotion of Traditional Handloom & Handicrafts
Income Generation Activities
REDP & SDP for Women groups
Capacity Building for staff on live stock management
Exposure

4) Health
Village level awareness program
Animation for village women & youth on health related topics
Medical camp once in six months
Work in collaboration with Govt. heath centres
Capacity Building for staff on health related issues 

5) Education
Village level awareness programme on the importance of education
Counseling cum Career guidance programme for higher class students
Seminar/workshop for students and teachers
Training on Computer Skills 


ACHIEVEMENTS
Reaching out to more than 1500 educated unemployed youth of the State within a span of 4 months through SDP programmes.

Formation of Self Help Groups to empower rural women in economic development ventures.

Formation of Farmers Club to help and support 300 farmers in agri-related activities with the application of modern science and technologies.

Awareness programme in legal aid and importance of education in rural areas. 

Awareness programme in health related issues and helping the poor through free medical camps.

Generating employment for unemployed educated youth by setting up of  handloom and handicrafts units.

source_info.purpose: CHILDLINE 1098 is a phone number that spells hope for millions of children across India. It is a 24-hour a day, 365 days a year, free, emergency phone service for children in need of aid and assistance. We not only respond to the emergency needs of children but also link them to relevant services for their long-term care and rehabilitation. We have, till date, connected to three million children across the nation offering them care and protection

0.Major_Activities1: Implemented the National Bamboo Mission programme in Lohit District. Conducted capacity building of PRIs in water quality testing and monitoring by handling field test kits in Lohit and Anjaw districts. Conducted REDP with assistance from NABARD in Telluliang village for rural women.Invovled in formation and promotion of SHGs and farmers club with assistance from SBI,DRDA and NABARD.conducted total sanitation campaign with PHE Department in Lohit and Anjaw districts.Conducted 15 days state level khadi exhibition cum trade fair to market rural artisans product at Tezu with support from KVIC and National Youth Project.Supported various youth development projects like adventure camps for adolescents,youth leadership training,entrepreneurship development programmes with Nehru Yuva Kendra,Tezu.Besides the NGO has participated in various capacity building programmes such as workshop on NBM,water quality testing and monitoring,BRGF,rural marketting of SHG products,rural tourism by NEDfi,REDP by NABARD,Micro credit by NEDfi and many other training programmes.The NGO has also facilitated marketting of Agri products such as ginger to Delhi sabzi mandi through NERAMAC and APMC.

0.Major_Activities1:
As of now the organisation is involved in a variety of activities such as-
(a)	A Residential School for Tribal Children from remote pockets who are the unreached and the unprivileged. It is an ongoing project sponsored by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Govt. of India. The school at present catering to the need of quality education to 280 children ranging from 1st to 10th Standard and is duly recognized by the Directorate of School Education, Govt. of A.P. and affiliated to CBSE,
(b)	A Mobile Dispensary Unit sponsored by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Govt of India, New Delhi, in order to bridge the gap of medical services to the people in the remote pockets in the state of Arunachal Pradesh, 
(c)	A De-Addiction Centre sponsored by the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Government of India for Prevention of Drug Abuse for a healthy drugs abuse free society in the state,
(d)	3 Targeted Intervention Project for Prevention of HIV/AIDS which projects are being in the entire Lohit District covering the core and bridge population,
(e)	A Museum cum Research Centre for preservation of arts and artifacts and research on Tai Khamti & Singpho People and Culture in the state of Arunachal Pradesh and
(f)	Running of a Guest House for visitors to the place

0.Major_Activities1:
Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti

Main Achievements
The notable educational achievements of Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti are as follows:
1.	Providing qualitative nationalistic education through 16 nos of coeducational schools in 10 districts of Arunachal Pradesh. These schools are located in remote interior villages of Arunachal Pradesh with low access to quality education In these schools, activities for the integrated development of the five aspects (five koshas) of human personality through the five core areas of  Sharirik (Physical), Yog, Sanskrit, Sangeet (Music) and Naitik â€“Adhyatmik  (Moral & Spiritual ) Education are effectively carried out.

2.	Running 9 (nine) numbers of Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalayas (KGBVs) in 2 (two) districts of Siang and East Siang districts of Arunachal Pradesh. These schools are exclusively residential and free Schools for girls under SSA aimed universalisation of elementary education. These 9 KGBVs run by Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samti have evolved to be the best and model schools among the government projects in Arunachal Pradesh because of its quality education program in the lines of Vidya Bharati as well as the vocational and specific skill development programs conducted in these schools.

3.	Providing academic and allied support to 5 (five) nos of Associated Schools in 3 districts of Upper Subansiri, Changlang and Namsai. Though directly not managed by the Samiti, these schools also follow the quality educational programs (scholastic and co-scholastic) of Vidya Bharati and bring out qualitative outcomes. The local management bodies of these schools are getting expertise regarding school administration from the Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti.
 
4.	Regularly organizing teacherâ€™s quality enhancement programs like Teachersâ€™ Training, workshops, etc. Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti conducts Teachers Training camps of 10 day duration with at least 50 â€“ 60 teachers every year. Through these training camps, the Samiti imparts training to teachers in the areas of qualitative  teaching learning methods, effective ways of evaluation, preparation of low cost/ no cost teaching aids, etc. More than 500 teachers have been effectively trained through these camps so far.

5.	Annually organizing inter school sports, Science fests, literary and cultural competitions, Band Training, Personality Development camps, etc for students. In these separate events sports competitions like races, jumps (long jump & high jump), shot put and discus throw, games like kabaddi, volley ball, tug of war, archery etc are conducted and the hidden talents in those areas are traced and promoted. In the Science Fests under the Akhil Bharatiya Vigyan Mela scheme of Vidya Bharati, competitions among students are conducted at school level, cluster level and  state level in the areas of science experimentation, exhibition, paper presentation, science quiz etc and the winners are awarded with prizes and promoted for higher level competitions. Similar efforts are being made through the Kala and Sanskritik Melas, etc in the respective fields.

6.	Promotion of Girls Education has been one of the key areas of attention for the Vidya Bharati and Arunachal Shiksha Vikas Samiti as well. The Samiti has been following the Balika Shiksha karyakram of the Vidya Bharati in true spirit and organizing special programs like Balika Shivir (Girlsâ€™ Convention) Exhibition of Vocational and craft items prepared by girl students under the intervention of Balika Shiksha (Girls Education). Balika Sabhas and Matri Bharatis (Mothersâ€™Councils) etc in the all schools.

7.	Shiksha Setu: Identification of promising students with bright scholastic career for free education in Vidya Bharati schools outside the state. Nearly 50 students benefitted so far

0.Major_Activities1:
Over the years the Society has been working untiringly to achieve the following  objectives with the well- knit organizational structure.  

a) To preserve and promote Buddhist cultural heritage of India and the local folk culture including rituals, performing arts and local traditional handicrafts.

b) To preserve and protect holy places, sacred enclosures and historical monuments in the West Kameng and Tawang districts of Arunachal Pradesh.

c) To establish and run hospitals, schools and other educational institutions for the benefit of the poor and unprivileged section of the rural population.

d) To undertake research and publication works.
We have established the following institutions for the socio-cultural and spiritual upliftment of the tribals in this frontier region: 
i) Gontse Gaden Rabgye Ling Monastery,  Bomdila
ii) Central Institute of Himalayan Culture Studies, Dahung(Now taken over by the Govt. of India)
iii) Shanti Deva Vidyalaya, Mon Bomdila
iv) Monyul Development Centre, Lhou
v) Gorsam Stupa Culture Centre, Zemithang
vi) Jangchub Choeling Nunnery, Lhou
vii) Dolma Lhakhang, Lumla
viii) Computer Training Center, Mon Bomdila
ix)  Sowa-Rigpa  and Allopathic Clinic, Bomdila

0.Major_Activities1:
Introduction:
Centre for Buddhist Cultural Studies was established and developed into a residential school on proper lines based on modern education system into the framework of traditional education system of the monastery. It was established in 1977 to impart monastic as well as modern education to the monk students. 

The following major activities of Centre for Buddhist Cultural Studies as follow: 
1.	Established a residential school for the education of monk students, where basic education is imparted free of cost. 
2.	Conducted various workshops and seminars on the preservation and promotion the rich cultural heritage of the region which face various challenges for survival in todayâ€™s fast changing world. 
3.	Imparted traditional monastic education to younger resident monks with a balance incorporation of modern languages and scientific knowledge with objective of producing erudite scholars and philosophers who are capable of preserving and carrying on the ancient cultural heritages of the region in the context of modern day situation.
4.	Prepared students for higher learning and research in the field of the Buddhist Culture, Tibetology and Himalayan Studies, art and culture with adequate background in various disciplines of learning, with thorough knowledge of modern research and advanced technique.
5.	Inculcated awareness in the preservation of environment and cultural resources of the region.
6.	Inculcated deep feeling of patriotism, national integrity, brotherhood, and developing a greater sense of harmony in the country.
7.	Produced ideal citizens who work for the development of the nation and its citizens.
8.	Made full utilization of modern scientific and technological resources in preserving and promoting the age old wisdom of India for the benefit of entire sentient beings as a whole and Schedule Tribes community in particular.
9.	Provided free medical treatments to the monk patients along with needy patients belonging to poor family background.
10.	Planted saplings around Tawang Monastery and other adjoining areas which are vulnerable to landslides and other natural calamities.
11.	Conducted cleanliness drive at important public buildings such as schools, hospitals and market areas as a part of Swach Bharat Abhiyan.
12.	Established a library inside the premises of Tawang Monastery which is open to general public from 10 am to 4 pm, irrespective of caste, creed, community etc. The library houses books on varied subjects ranging from education, science to politics.

0.Major_Activities1:
1.	To promote the peace and harmony among the various section of people irrespective of caste and creed.
2.	To provide free education and skill development training to poor tribal women for their empowerment and economic development of their family.
3.	To maintain the unity, integrity among the indigenous tribe of Arunachal Pradesh in particular and India as whole throughout the Chayang Mission.
4.	To learn the Ethics and moral doctrines of truthfulness straightness, love to parents, respect to and compassion self respect equality, fraternity self dependents and self sufficient and mercy.
5.	To establish Educational Institution for better brain culture and work culture.
6.	To encourage and promote tradition rich handicraft and handloom, SSI unit and business venture.
7.	To promote Tourism and focus the people of other state in natural beauty and all about its flora and fauna.
8.	To establish piggery farm, Dairy farm, Goatery Farm, Fishery for self income generation purpose and other vocational orientation Institution.
9.	To protect and preserve the hidden indigenous rich culture of Tribal societies.
10.	To assist the Govt. in the time of any national emergency such as natural calamities and epidemics etc.
11.	To protect against destruction of environment eco friendly such as fish in natural water wild life and destruction of forest.
12.	To encourage the social forestry in the State.
13.	To discourage the social evil practices such as polygamy, child marriage, force marriage and bonded labour.
14.	To promote the living condition of rural masses by imparting awareness campaign about the Govt. plans and programmes.
15.	To dissuade the Jhum cultivation.
16.	To motivate, to organize the local people for promoting the Tea Cultivation, Horticulture, Agriculture & Sericulture etc.
17.	To establish Medicinal plantation for economic gain of the society.
18.	This society may establish shelter for old age men & women.
19.	To establish forest base industry like cane, bamboo and wood etc.
20.	To establish adult education centers.
21.	To encourage and establish village forest area.
22.	To acquire by gifts, purchase, exchange lease on higher or otherwise however and land building, easement and any property movables or immovable of any estate for the furtherance of all or the objectives of the institution.
23.	To acquire funds from abroad for the fulfillment of any or all the above mentioned aim and objectives of the Mission with prior permission from the Government of India from time to time.
24.	To do all other lawful things incidental or duly constitute managing committee as provided in the rules and regulations of the institution from time to time.

0.Major_Activities1:
To work for the overall Development of the society.
To undertake project for self- employment such as horticulture and agriculture development.
To shoulder responsibilities of relief and rehabilitation works and render voluntary services to the people especially during the of natural calamities/ epidemics and other emergencies.
 To maintain the highest possible standard of humanitarian service by running welfare institute like orphanage/ Orphan school/ old age homes/Vocational Institute/ Training centers/ health center/ welfare of woman/ widow/ Welfare of children/ woman adult Education/ Discourage of Child and Force marriage.
To assist and undertake preventive and control measures in disaster prone zones and crisis management in disaster stricken localities.
To promote eco-tourism.
To encourage rainwater rainwater harvesting and promote use of non- conventional means of energy in remote areas especially solar.
To established functional linkages with other reputed NGOs functioning at state, Region,Nation, And International Level.
There shall not be any profit motive while carrying out the activities and achieving the objects of the society. the surplus fund/ assist, if shall be utilized only in furtherance of the object of the society.
Promote entrepreneurship in both rural and urban areas.
Working handloom and handicraft activities and rural areas.
To cooperate, collaborate with center/state and other agencies to undertake development programmes in Rural and Urban Areas.
To conduct and also to assist in organising training and study courses, conferences, seminar, workshops etc. on rural development and allied subjects.
To work towards better health in rural and urban areas, create awareness on AIDS/HIV and to address other similar issue in the broader interest of people.
Accept grants of money securities of property of any kind undertaken and accept the management of any endowment, trust, fund or donation not inconsistent with the object of the society on such terms from time to time.
To receive grants and aids from othe World Bank and also contribution/donation from NRIs and other well-wisher to achieve  the objrct of the society.
Invest and deal with funds moneys of the society.
Impose and recover fee and charge for the services rendered by it.
Purchase hire take on lease exchange or otherwise acquire a property movable or immovable which may be necessary or convenient for the purpose the society and construct after and or maintain such building and works as may be necessary for carrying out the object of the society.
sell, hire, lease exchange or otherwise transfer or dispose of all or any property, movable or immovable of the society provide that for the transfer of immobile property prior approval in writing of the Government of Arunachal Pradesh is obtained in that behalf.
Draw, accept, make, endorse, discount and deposit Government of India and other promissory item, bills of exchange, cheque or other negotaible instrument.
Create reserve Fund, sinking Fund, Insurance Fund or any other especial fund whether for depreciation, repairs, improvements, extension or maintenance of any of the properties or rights of the society and/or for recouping, wasting and for any other purpose for which the society deems it expedient or proper to create or maintain any such fund or funds.
The area of operation of the society will be throughout Arunachal Pradesh and need based within the National Boundaries.

0.Major_Activities1:
Gyang-Gon Welfare Association was established in 2004 and developed into a residential school on proper lines based on modern education system into the framework of traditional education system of the monastery. It was established to impart monastic as well as modern education to the nun students. The following major activities of Gyang-Gon Welfare Association as follow: 
1. Established a residential school for the education of nun students, where basic education is imparted free of cost. 
2. Conducted various workshops and seminars on the preservation and promotion the rich cultural heritage of the region which face various challenges for survival in todayâ€™s fast changing world. 
3. Imparted traditional monastic education to younger resident nuns with a balance incorporation of modern languages and scientific knowledge with objective of producing erudite scholars and philosophers who are capable of preserving and carrying on the ancient cultural heritages of the region in the context of modern day situation. 
4. Prepared students for higher learning and research in the field of the Buddhist Culture, Tibetology and Himalayan Studies, art and culture with adequate background in various disciplines of learning, with thorough knowledge of modern research and advanced technique. 
5. Inculcated awareness in the preservation of environment and cultural resources of the region. 
6. Inculcated deep feeling of patriotism, national integrity, brotherhood, and developing a greater sense of harmony in the country. 
7. Produced ideal citizens who work for the development of the nation and its citizens. 
8. Made full utilization of modern scientific and technological resources in preserving and promoting the age old wisdom of India for the benefit of entire sentient beings as a whole and Schedule Tribes community in particular. 
9. Provided free medical treatments to the monk patients along with needy patients belonging to poor family background. 
10. Planted saplings around the nunnery and other vulnerable locations to prevent landslides and other natural calamities. 
11. Conducted cleanliness drive at important public buildings such as schools, hospitals and market areas as a part of Swacch Bharat Abhiyan.

0.Major_Activities1:
1.	Formed 80 SGHs & 40 Farmers club in collaboration with NABARD Itanagar.  
2.	Conducted orientation & awareness programme on agriculture, horticulture, environment, etc,
3.	Conducted skill development training on handloom, weaving, plumbing, house wiring, handicraft, tailoring, pickle, mobile repairing, computer basic application, etc in collaboration with the department of skill development, govt of Arunachal Pradesh.
4.	Conducted training on bee keeping, book keeping, record maintaining and bank linkage.
5.	Conducted training programme on PMEGP, PMJDY, Financial Literacy, household survey and made MOA with Arunachal Pradesh Apex Bank for business facilitator.
6.	Led exposure visit  of farmer to Sikkim, Kerala, Pasighat, Assam, etc
7.	Conducted condense course, skill programme on horticulture and agriculture in collaboration with the department of agriculture and horticulture, govt of Arunachal Pradesh.
8.	Entrusted as agent for distribution of artisan health insurance card issued from ICICI.
9.	Felicitated with certificate from Deputy Commissioner.
10.	Running Primary English School

0.Major_Activities1: Accredited with KVIC, Working in association with NYP (Delhi), Ekta Parishad (Bhopal), All India Hope Line (Delhi), Gandhi Peace Foundation (Delhi).Last six month Society organise National Integration Youth Camp at Itanagar for 550 youths from 22 states took part, In the month of March society organise 1st National Level Trades Fair cum Khadi Exhibition at Tezu under Lohit District, organise KVIC sponsored EAP, EDP, PEP, ABFPI, and Exhibition in 6 districts. Workshop in collaboration with Ali Yavar Jung National Institute of Hearing Handicapped(Mumbai) at Itanagar. conducted various awareness programme at Itanagar, Running 2 units of handloom and Handicrafts at Itanagar and Chongkham respectively. Running youth hostels at its Itanagar office . Society has 11 district units office and running all the programes in those districts. Society have more than 10,000 volunteers till now. Society send more than 2000 youths in different parts of our country for various national and international level camps, workshops, seminars, etc. and also for youth exchange programme.

0.Major_Activities1:
1. Started Monastic School with Academic Subjects are being taught to more than 130 Students.
2.With the financial support from the Ministry of Culture, Govt of India the society has started Computer Training Centre, where students are taught both basic and and advance usage of computer knowledge and its advantages in day to day life activities. 
3. Promoted various social welfare programs in Tawang Dist and West Kameng Dist of Arunachal Pradesh
4. Renovated and repaired ancient monuments, Stupas, Monasteries in both districts of Tawang and West Kameng
5.Conducted Worksho for conservation and preservation of Environment Cleanliness and natural habitats.
6.Special course on Buddhist Philosophy conducted at various local monasteries and institutes.
7. 3 Months long Meditation retreats and camps were conducted at Khinmey Monastery.
8.More than 40 monks students participate in annual religious special puja held in Bodha Gaya, Bihar, India
9. Construction of 20 feet Medicine Buddha Statue is undertaken
10. Further, the society is celebrating various religious and national festivals like:
(i) Buddha Poornima
(ii)Birth Anniversary of Guru Padmasambhava
(iii First Teaching day of Lord Buddha
(iv)Saka Dawa
(v)Independence Day
(vi)Republic Day
(vii)Teachers Day
(viii)Gandhi Jayanti 
During these special occasions, thousands of people gather and celebrate. The Society is also engaged in various charitable programs and activities.

0.Major_Activities1:
1.	INTRODUCTION
Arunachal Pradesh sprawling over an area of over 83,743 sq km (of which around 70,000 sq km lies in the lap of the Himalayas) is a unique region of India - situated at the far end of Indiaâ€™s North-East. West Kameng and Tawang districts are originally known as Mon Region, are situated in the extreme western fringe of Arunachal Pradesh. The region has a distinct geographical entity which is strategically important for the security of the state of Arunachal Pradesh in particular and nation in general. The region shares international border with Tibet (China) in the north and Bhutan in the South. West Kament district is inhabited by Monpa along with other tribes like Shertukpen, Bugun, Miji, Aka etc. While the Tawang district is exclusively home for  the Monpasâ€™. Besides from different name , ther are similar in their social and cultural lifestyle. For instance traditional dresses and ornaments etc. traditional songs and similar in their languages can also be seen.
The regions have tremendous scope for development of power, tourism, horticulture etc but there has not been focused attention. Only after Chinese aggression in 1962 the importance of the region was felt by the Government  
Kalaktang is in the extreme western fringe of West Kameng District that comes under BADP sharing the International Border with Bhutan in the west and National border with Assam in the South.
2.	BACKGROUND: 
The land of Mon is popularly known as the birth place of Khandro Drowa Zangmo(Dakini) of 7th century as in mentioned in her biography. During 8th century Lord Padma Sambhava visited this monyul Kyid-mo-jong (Happy Valley) and guided us.â€œKa-La-Thangâ€- Now Popularly known as Kalaktang There was a king Gyelpo Kala Wangpo of Mendrolgang during 6th century . He used to go hunting in the in the thang means the valley. It was his favourite spot where he loved to spend most of his free time. He also married a Dakini Khandro Drowa Zangmo. The very valley -Thang is named after the King Kala Wangpo. Hence, the name Kalaktang means the valley of king Ka La Wangpo. The story of khandro Drowa Zangmo  is published in many different languages and also movie have been made in many countries like Bhutan, Tibet(China). Even today the story is being narrated by the elders to their young ones.
Geographically Kalaktang Circle shares the international border with Bhutan in the West and national border with Assam in the South.
Under the Guidance of H.E. Sonam Lodre Rinpoche and hard work of Sri. Dorjee Tsering (G.B. Samphung Vill.) and Lama Sonam Yeshi Wangdi. TAK-TSANG Nyepa Vejra Ling Gonpa is been build along with the cliff of the mountain where any monks can go on retreat. 
Ngagyur Sangchen Pema Woedling Gonpa also have a small Buddhist school was established by H.E. Bhuli Rinpoche and Sri Dorjee Tsering G.B. Of Samphung for the benefit of local and preservation of heritage and culture as the Samphung Village has been performing Bardo dance(Monastic Dance) since 45 years. Under Ven. Lama Sonam Yeshi Wangdi and Gen Sithar Wangdi both is graduate from Ngagyur Drodull Tsang Chen Shedra(Bhutan), 25 Residential monks and many non-residential from different villages use to come there and receiving teaching.
For conservational point of view of Buddhist Religion as we are very near BTC (Boro Territorial Council), Assam. They are trying to convince our local people for Christianity and it could hamper our heritage and culture. As, all our Monpaâ€™s culture is a gift of Buddhism.
3.	Need and significance

(i)	As every year there is a mass gathering in the area for performing Shiddhi Dung Drub from our nabouring country Bhutan as well the local public of the area for their participation in this Religious act etc.
(ii)	As per the customary practice of the Buddhist Communities of this area every household has been under the religious obligation to send at least one of their children to monastery for nun-hood. These novices are given both the general and theological education in the monastic school.
(iii)	Since Cultural and Educational Rights are the Fundamental Rights conferred by the Indian constitution upon its citizens, which states that all minorities, religious or linguistic, can set up their own educational institutions in order to preserve and develop their own culture. Hence, the Government and civil society must also facilitate these novice Buddhist Monks with educational facilities towards fulfilling its constitutional obligations along with the similar facilities for destitute.
(iv)	Kalaktang is situated in the backward, tribal and border area resided by the Buddhist minorities and backward scheduled tribes. Here large chunk of rural population is reeling under the burden of poverty. Hence, people  in the rural areas of Kalaktang have least access to educational opportunity. Hence, they must be provided with special assistance by the civil society for their educational and cultural upliftment.

4.	Aims :	

Values of traditional art and culture are gradually being eroded by modernization and the so-called westernization. And the day is not far, if corrective steps are not taken well in time, when we will have completely severed ourselves with the age-old traditional cultural heritage. The aims of the school is in no way opposed to modernization or advancement in field of science and technology, but rather to make use of the advance knowledge in science and technology to further the cause of preservation of art and cultural heritages of our country. One cannot afford to lose our links with our rich cultural heritages. Therefore, the proposed school will play an important role towards preserving our culture, tradition, literature etc.

5.	CONSTRAINTS : 
PADMAPA FELLOWSHIP, This association is a non-profit organization and its objectives are to: 
a)  Coordinate and administer the development, management and sustenance of Ngagyur Sangchen Pema Woedling Gonpa, its events and associated institutions and activities.
  b)  Sustain and continue the tradition of providing opportunities for education, study and practice of Buddhism and its traditions along with the modern education which is essential in todayâ€™s livelihood.
  c)  Raise funds, make investments and manage the assets of Ngagyur Sangchen Pema Woedling Gonpa and its associated institution and activities.
  d)  Organize Kurims (Puja), prayers, other religious events, Social service education   for the well being of all the mankind.
e) Promote, encourage and facilitate the continued advance of Buddhism through Wang, Lung, Thri ceremonies, Lectures and Seminars, Buddhism meditation and retreat centers and through establishment of religious institute and study centers.

6.	Location of the Project 
The project Proposed for Construction of Cultural cum community Hall is located at Sumbrang of Samphung Vill. Kalaktang which is 08 kms from Kalaktang town with the objective of educating the Buddhist novice monks and general public of the area Kalaktang and other.

7.	Conclusion:

		With the road map of the project school outlined above, it is expected to fulfill the education and cultural needs of the Buddhist community of Kalaktang Circle in particular and monks of Himalayan Region in general and shall be instrumental in creating education and cultural awareness among the people of the area and state.

Aalo a city of West Siang District is a place inhabited by various tribes like Galo, Adi (Minyong, Libo, Pailibo, Ramo, Bori, Bokar), Memba, Khamba etc. All the tribes are having their own culture. All tribes have their different cultural practices

source_info.purpose: The Arunachal Pradesh is remote and backward. Hospital facilities are not adequate. Resident population is various Scheduled Tribes communities. Most of them are very poor. Thus, the project is highly justifies.

The Arunachal Pradesh is remote and backward. Hospital facilities are not adequate. Resident population is various Scheduled Tribes communities. Most of them are very poor. Thus, the project is highly justifies.

The continuation of grants-in-aid to this project " Maintenance of 60 Bedded Hospital" will benefit the economically weaker section of the tribal population of this state. We would like to inform you that we have not received any grants-in-aid for this project for the year 2016 -17. Anticipating that we would be receiving the grants, we had spent the amount from our hospital’s fund.

Processing of proposals for Grant-in-aid for Ramakrishna Mission Hospital, Itanagar, Arunachal Pradesh for the year 2017-2018 for the project "Maintenance of 60 Bedded Hospital" through the on-line processing system is under process.

0.ngo_name: Research institute of Worlds Ancient Traditions Cultures and Heritage
0.Major_Activities1: Research Institute of Worlds Ancient Traditions Cultures and Heritage has been primarily workig in the field of Education and Research. The main onbjective is to link culture with sustainable develoment. As on today, RIWATCH has successfully addressed core issues related to ethnic life of the people of north east India. It has done research on TB involving Guwahati Medical College, Stanford University California. The research has been published in Science Translational Medicine Journal. The RIWATCH has publish four Peoples Biodiversity Registers for SMPB and UNDP. It has also published folktales of Idu-Mishmis and conducted number of Seminars and workshops on Himalayan Herbs and cultural traditions and Heritage. While reaching to the rural communities RIWATCH could develop volunteers in addressing woemn and child helth issues. Then up tow major researches on famly violence and nutrition. It also provides career counselling to the school going students. RIWATCH has also launched Back Pack Librarian to take good books in border areas and developing good reading habits among school going children

0.Major_Activities1:
THE SOCIETY ENGAGED IN VARIOUS SOCIAL WELFARE ACTIVITIES.
1.Sera Deki Gatselling Monastery: The Sera Deki Gatseling Monastery was establised with the Society initiative in 2001 to preserve Buddhist Culture and its unique tradition.The Society has attempted the various projects for the extension of the Monastery- such as Monastic School, Renovation, and accommandation for the Monks to the concern Govt. Departments.
2.Family Counselling Centre: The Family Counseling Centre run by the Society since 2012 under the aegis of Central Social Welfare Board works in and around the district.It renders services to the society by addressing various atrocities, especially against woman.
3.Awareness Programme on Child Labour:The Society has been continue conducting awareness programme on child labour in different places to protect the child in our locality.The condition in which the children work is completely unregulated in our juridiction.In order to remove such type of social evil. 
4.Awareness Programme on SHG(Self Help Group):The Society has organised awareness programme on SHG and Farmers club in the village to avail government assisstence and the villagers were also inspire and motivated to play the vital role in the social and economic development of the region and were also encouraged them to stand on their own feet to earn active place in the society.

0.Major_Activities1:
Take Bogo Welfare Society, Old Ziro has been working with the aim to stand on unity, social welfare, co-operation, socio-economic and commercial development and objectives to (a) undertake handloom and handicrafts activities (b) undertake R & D on Agro-Forestry, Science and Technology and other forest based activities. (c) undertake Agriculture, Horticulture, Fisheries and Veterinary activities (d) impart Nursing House Education, Typing Institution and Computer Training Centre (e) initiate training programmes on Piggery, Dairy, Fishery, Handloom, Horticulture and all other related socio-economic development issues (f) cultivate medicinal plants, orchid garden, apple orchards, kiwi plantation and large cardamom plantation (g) establish industry for manufacturing plastic/metal products and (h) any other activities as my be conducive for socio-economic development of the rural tribal populace.  


a.	Intervention of Technology for Integrated Farming of Piggery Fishery along with Horticulture crops for Socio-Economic development of Rural people of Ziro, Lower Subansiri District, Arunachal Pradesh.
b.	Awareness Generation on Soil Pollution and Conservation of Soil in Arunachal Pradeh.
c.	Science Exhibition & Technology Demonstration for Scheduled Tribe in Itanagar & Naharlagun of Papum Pare District, Arunachal Pradesh.

0.Major_Activities1: We have declared 635 Sq.km of our forest area as Community Conserved Area to conserve our rich forest area. We have promoted community based eco-tourism as an incentive to the villagers for their conservation initiatives. We are also working on bio-briquette production to reduce consumption of firewood. We have formed SHGs for handicraft and handloom production to be sold to the market. We are also exploring the micro-finance system to make these SHGs self sustainable

0.Major_Activities1:
Activities of the Organization during year 2015-16.

	The organization has been undertaking multidisciplinary activities in the area since its inception in the year 2006. Few of the remarkable activities worth highlighting are as:

a)	Making Audio Visual Documentation and Archiving of Buddhist Monastic and Folk dances under Ministry of Culture, GoI.
b)	Organizing medical health camps across region in collaboration with 4th Bn ITBP Dirang and also with NRCY ICAR Dirang at Thembang Village, Salari Village, Rahung Village etc.
c)	Distribution of Blankets, Study Tables, Hygiene utilities to Primary School Students at Thembang Residential School in collaboration with ICAR-National Research Centre on Yak.
d)	Allotment of kitchen wares to Thembang Monastery.
e)	Encouraging the production of local garments, handicrafts & its use especially among youths.
f)	Massive plantation drive in & around the Dirang rural outskirts.
g)	Intensive Awareness programmes on Environment, Biodiversity its significance & conservation aspects.
h)	Training on vermin composting & organic farming at Thembang village.
i)	Encouraging the youths to undergo training on revered pantomime dance forms of the Himalayan region. 
j)	Promotion of tourism in the area, Mon- Thembang heritage Village.
k)	Organized seminar on the need to preserve the Himalayan art & culture at Thembang Gompa.

0.Major_Activities1: So far Our Society has formed 26 Natural Resource Management Group (NaRM-Gs) under by covering 20 villages with 60 Self Help Groups(SHGs) under NERCORMP-III Changlang Arunachal Pradesh,The work undertaken by NaRM-Gs and SHGs are supervise by the Supervising Officer and Community Cordinators of  our NGO staffs. Organised Free medical camp in the interior villages of Kantang circle,Khimiyang circle , Changlang circle and Yatdam circle in Changlang district Arunachal Pradesh in collaboration with the Seva Bharati Purbanchal and National Medicos Organisation since last three years ,taken up self drinking water programmed, poultry & piggery programmed and also construct individual household toilets in the interior villages.Our Society are also taking up horticulture base Large Cardamom garden under Khimiyang and Kantang circle. Organised  awareness campaign on drugs de-addiction camp at Khimiyang,Yatdam and Kantang circle,Awareness campaign on preservation of old age traditional art & culture of Tutsa tribes & Tangsa tribes of Changlang district. Health and hygiene,child education programmed once in a year.  skill development training for youths, social welfare programmed conducted in many villages specially on sustainable development of cash crops like kitchen garden etc. Organised social service camp in the interior villages under Khimiyang circle on 2nd October since last 3 years. Raksha bandhan programmed with students and teachers at Assam Rifle Camp at Changlang to bring peace and harmony among the civil and para-military. Organised awareness programmed with students and public on HIV- AIDS, maintenance of law & order problems and to co-ordinate with district administration and civil police.

0.ngo_name: Tsun Gon Thoog Jee Ling Society
0.Major_Activities1:
Tsun-Gon-Thoog-Jee-Ling Society was established in 2002 and developed into a residential school on proper lines based on modern education system into the framework of traditional education system of the monastery. It was established to impart monastic as well as modern education to the nun students. The following major activities of Tsun-Gon-Thoog-Jee-Ling Society as follow: 
1. Established a residential school for the education of nun students, where basic education is imparted free of cost. 
2. Conducted various workshops and seminars on the preservation and promotion the rich cultural heritage of the region which face various challenges for survival in todayâ€™s fast changing world. 
3. Imparted traditional monastic education to younger resident nuns with a balance incorporation of modern languages and scientific knowledge with objective of producing erudite scholars and philosophers who are capable of preserving and carrying on the ancient cultural heritages of the region in the context of modern day situation. 
4. Prepared students for higher learning and research in the field of the Buddhist Culture, Tibetology and Himalayan Studies, art and culture with adequate background in various disciplines of learning, with thorough knowledge of modern research and advanced technique. 
5. Inculcated awareness in the preservation of environment and cultural resources of the region. 
6. Inculcated deep feeling of patriotism, national integrity, brotherhood, and developing a greater sense of harmony in the country. 
7. Produced ideal citizens who work for the development of the nation and its citizens. 
8. Made full utilization of modern scientific and technological resources in preserving and promoting the age old wisdom of India for the benefit of entire sentient beings as a whole and Schedule Tribes community in particular. 
9. Provided free medical treatments to the monk patients along with needy patients belonging to poor family background. 
10. Planted saplings around the nunnery and other vulnerable locations to prevent landslides and other natural calamities. 
11. Conducted cleanliness drive at important public buildings such as schools, hospitals and market areas as a part of Swacch Bharat Abhiyan.

source_info.purpose: THE NGO WAS FORMED WITH A AN AIM TO FIGHT FOR JUSTICE OF RIVER BY LAUCHING INTENSIVE MASS AWARENESS CAMPAING TO PRESERVE, PROTECT, CONSERVE AND REJUVENATE THE DYING STREAMS AND RIVERS   ACROSS THE STATE, OUR NGO HAS ORGANISED CLEAN UP RIVER MISSION IN THE VARIOUS RIVERS OF THE STATE SPECIALLY THE DYING SENKI RIVER WHICH PASSES THROUGH THE HEARTS OF THE STATE CAPITAL  i.e ITANAGAR AND NAHARLAGUN CITIES. THE NGO HAS BROUGHT MANY CASES RELATING TO RIVER POLUTION BEFORE THE NATIONAL GREEN TRIBUNAL .

0.Major_Activities1: The Ziro Valley Charity Mission Society (ZVCMS) was established on 9th December, 1998 and was registered under the society registration Act. 1860, extension in Arunachal Pradesh 1978 bearing register No. SR/ITA/2055/in year 2003. The Society aim to promoting of any art; science or any other field of socio-economic education, propagate for removal of society evils, custom or render or promote self help to overcome any of these evils particularly for the poor or weaker section of the society and established the school, hostel for orphan and arrange medical aid, free elementary education to the poor children and other assistance necessary for living to the needy person. Through the aim of charity Mission and promote modern methods of Medicinal plant and Aromatic plant garden, Horticulture Animal & Husbandry, Fisheries Handloom & Handicraft. The Society is spreading an environment conservation message to different part of the state through various network to all those nature loving people to crate conservation awareness in most effective manner through the school children, banner, poster, Newsletter, Pam plate, Magazine etc. and organizing the variety programmed as per Govt. of India prescribed.
